owl:Ontology.dc:title: Ontology for the Lipid Identification Service (LIS)
owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Mariano Fernández López
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: This is is the ontology assumed by the [Lipid Identification Service (LIS)](https://github.com/marianofl1971/lis). It defines notions like experiment, hypothesis, empirical compound, theoretical compound, etc. The examples in JSON have been validated using [JSONLint](https://jsonlint.com/), and the examples in JSON-LD, using [JSON-LD Playground](https://json-ld.org/playground/).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It relates certainty assignments with explanations to certainty levels.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has certainty level

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It is the relation between entities (e.g. hypotheses) and empirical compounds.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has empirical compound

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It relates entities (e.g. certainty level assignments with explanations) to explanations.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has explanation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It is the relation between entities (e.g. experiments or certainty level assignments with explanations) and hypotheses.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has hypothesis

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It relates experiments with ionization modes.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has ionization mode

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It relates explanations to rule types.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has rule type

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: It is the relation between entities (e.g. hypotheses) and theoretical compounds.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has theoretical compound

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an explanation of ionization rule to its additional information.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: additional information

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an entity (e.g. a hypothesis) with a string representing a compound playing the role of adduct.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: adduct

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an explanation to its core information.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: core information

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates a retention time rule explanation to an evidence against.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: evident against

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates a retention time rule explanation to an evidence for.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: evidence for

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an explanation with a string.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: explanation content

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: It allows selecting an entity unequivocally.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an entity (e.g. an empirical compound) to its mass.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: mass

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each fact instantiating this property relates an entity (e.g. a theoretical compound) to its name.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name

owl:Class.rdfs:label: adduct relation rule explanation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A certainty level assignment with explanations relates an hypothesis with a certainty level and with an explanation. That is, it is a reification of a ternary relation. Below is presented an example of certaintly level assignment with explanations in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "ruleType":"ionization_rule_type", "trueValue":"expected", "hypothesis": { "identifier":315, "empiricalCompound": {"mass":517.3172, "rt":19.4689}, "theoreticalCompound": {"identifier":2628, "name":"PC(O-14:0/2:0)"}, "adduct":"M+Na" }, "explanation": { "coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type": "https://w3id.org/def/lis#CLAwithExplanations", "ruleType":"ionization_rule_type", "trueValue":"expected", "hypothesis": { "identifier":315, "empiricalCompound": {"mass":517.3172, "rt":19.4689}, "theoreticalCompound": {"identifier":2628, "name":"PC(O-14:0/2:0)"}, "adduct":"M+Na" }, "explanation": { "coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } }
~~~~ LIS returns an array of certainty level assignments with explanations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: certainty level assignment with explanations

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The certainty levels can be _impossible_, _improbable_, _possible_, _expected_ or _sure_.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: certainty level

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An empirical compound is characterised by a mass and a retention time. Below is presented an example of empirical compound in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "mass": 425.3504, "retentionTime": 19.5463 } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type": "https://w3id.org/def/lis#EmpiricalCompound", "mass": 425.3504, "retentionTime": 19.5463 } ~~~~
owl:Class.rdfs:label: empirical compound
experiment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Text describing a reasoning process. Every explanation has a core information that, depending on the rule that has been fired, can be extended with more information. Below is presented an example of explanation in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type":"https://w3id.org/def/lis#Explanation",
"coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } ~~~~
owl:Class.rdfs:label: explanation
hypothesis

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Explanation of a ionization rule. If the same conclusion is attained through an adduct relation rule, additional information explaining this fact is added to the core information. Below is presented an example of ionization rule explanation in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type":"https://w3id.org/def/lis#IRExplanation",
"coreInformation":"The empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 (in an experiment with positive ionization and modifier NH3) is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+Na, which belongs to the hierarchy GP, GP01, GP0102", "additionalInformation":"The empirical compound 495.3352@19.4689 is expected to be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) with adduct M+H, because, for example, the empirical compound 517.3172@19.4689 with adduct M+Na may be the theoretical compound PC(O-14:0/2:0) as well." } ~~~~
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ionization rule explanation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: It can be positive or negative.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ionization mode
modifier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Explanation of the execution of a retention time rule. It can contain evidence for, evidence against or both. Below is presented an example of retention time rule explanation in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "coreInformation":"It is possible that the empirical compound 282.2563@31.2616 is the theoretical compound 10Z-Hexadecenyl acetate with adduct M+H. The theoretical compound is a _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and one double bond", "evidenceFor":"For example, the compound 280.2402@28.2695 may be the theoretical compound 10E,12E-Hexadecadienyl acetate with adduct M+H, another _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and 2 double bonds.", "evidenceAgainst":"For example, the compound 280.2402@28.2695 may be the theoretical compound 11-Hexadecynyl acetate with adduct M+H, another _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and no double bond." } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type":"https://w3id.org/def/lis#RTRExplanation",
"coreInformation":"It is possible that the empirical compound 282.2563@31.2616 is the theoretical compound 10Z-Hexadecenyl acetate with adduct M+H. The theoretical compound is a _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and one double bond", "evidenceFor":"For example, the compound 280.2402@28.2695 may be the theoretical compound 10E,12E-Hexadecadienyl acetate with adduct M+H, another _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and 2 double bonds.", "evidenceAgainst":"For example, the compound 280.2402@28.2695 may be the theoretical compound 11-Hexadecynyl acetate with adduct M+H, another _WE_OPENPAR_ lipid with 18 carbons and no double bond." } ~~~~
owl:Class.rdfs:label: retention rule explanation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The rule types are ionization, adduct relation and retention time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rule type

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A theoretical compound has a name and an identifier. Below is presented an example of theoretical compound in JSON (assuming a [particular context](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld)): ~~~~ { "identifier": 32675, "name": "L-palmitoylcarnitine" } ~~~~ and here, an example in JSON-LD: ~~~~ { "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marianofl1971/lis/master/OnToology/lis.owl/context/context.jsonld", "@type": "https://w3id.org/def/lis#TheoreticalCompound", "identifier": 32675, "name": "L-palmitoylcarnitine" } ~~~~
owl:Class.rdfs:label: theoretical compound
